Description: Painted wood and plaster figure of a lioness-headed goddess with rock crystal eyes seated upon a hollow throne containing a cat-mummy(?) and decorated with scenes of the king offering to Horus; inscribed with the cartouches of Amasis.
Curator's comments: See PM viii, p. 1159. Being studied as part of PhD by Elisabeth Greifenstein (University of Wuerzburg).
Condition: fair (incomplete -one arm missing, other broken at elbow); plaster cracked and peeling
Acquisition name: Donated by: Spencer Joshua Alwyne Compton, 2nd Marquess of Northampton
